title: Analyze two policies to regulate natural monopoly

content.question: The graph above shows the cost and revenue curves for a natural monopoly. Consider the following two policies for regulating this natural monopoly. Policy I: Require the monopoly to set quantity and price where demand equals marginal cost. Policy II: Require the monopoly to set quantity and price where demand equals average total cost. Which of the following is true of these policies?

choices.label: Both would result in the same level of output and price.
Both would result in an inefficient allocation of resources relative to the unregulated result.
Policy I would result in a lower level of output than would Policy II.
Policy I would result in a higher price than would Policy II.
Policy I might require the payment of a subsidy to the firm.

content.answer: Policy I might require the payment of a subsidy to the firm.
